item.description: SUBMITTED ABSTRACTS Arjan Berger (LCPQ, Toulouse) The one-point model: solving equations in pointland In the one-point model we consider a zero-dimensional space. The advantage of this model is that the many-body equations simplify enormously and can be solved analytically. In particular, the one-body Greenʼs function is a solution of a set of functional integro-differential equations, which relate the one-particle Greenʼs function to its functional derivative with respect to an external potential [1].
